intro: Dinacrusa cretica subsp. althaeoides, commonly known as the Cretan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and is often found in coastal and mountainous areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native habitat.
